location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 1426 of 1852 from Henry Edward Goldsmid, Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay to Lieutenant Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is granting the Resident permission to apply for a leave of absence from the Bombay Presidency. It also notes that the Governor of Bombay was pleased to hear that the policies the Resident has been implementing have contributed successfully to the current tranquillity of the Persian Gulf.It is noted that letter No. 1427 of 1852 has forwarded copies of letters f. 12 and f. 13 for the information of Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Assistant Resident in the Persian Gulf.
